info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 22 at 3:28AM PST until December 23 at 1:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...AREAS OF FREEZING RAIN AND WINTRY MIX POSSIBLE THURSDAY AFTERNOON INTO FRIDAY MORNING... .Cold arctic air could funnel down from the Willamette Valley, into the far northern area of Douglas County. This cold air would be in place while a warm front brings overrunning precipitation into the area. This will bring the threat of freezing rain until the cold air is scoured out by southerly winds expected late Thursday. East of the Cascades, a more wintry mix is expected, but pockets of cold air will maintain the possibility for freezing rain, especially from the Chemult area northward. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 1 AM PST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Freezing rain could result a thin layer of ice. * WHERE...Northwestern portions of Douglas County, including the communities of Drain, Elkton, Curtain and Scottsburg. This also includes portions of Highway 38 and I-5 from Rice Hill northward. * WHEN...From 1 PM Thursday to 1 AM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Ice will create slippery and hazardous road conditions, which may impact the morning commute. This could also create a slip hazard on walkways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Ice accumulation is expected to be minimal, but there is some uncertainty regarding exact amounts because it largely will depend on how fast the cold air scours out. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for freezing rain means that periods of slippery conditions will cause travel difficulties.
